hint.text: Use the Second Law of Thermodynamics

solution.text: The Second Law of Thermodynamics gives a fundamental limitation to the efficiency of a heat engine and the co-efficient of performance of a refrigerator. In simple terms, it says that efficiency of a heat engine \((\eta)\) can never be unity.

content.text: Is the following statement true or false? An ideal heat engine will have an efficiency \((\eta)\) of 1
